content: Two weeks ago, a medical board constituted in the issue had said that attempts to retrieve the guide wire which has become fused with the vein could be dangerous

title: NMC data shows India added just 21 doctors in a year when 80k graduated
content: India's doctor count appears stagnant, with the National Medical Commission (NMC) data showing minimal growth despite thousands graduating annually. Significant discrepancies exist between NMC figures and state medical council registrations, raising concerns about accurate healthcare planning and potentially misleading Parliament.

title: 'Adult content': Akhilesh questions FB account suspension; claims post on journo, woman's death
content: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav's Facebook account, with over 8.5 million followers, was temporarily suspended, sparking accusations of silencing opposition voices. Yadav stated the suspension was due to posts about a journalist's murder and a woman's suspicious death, questioning pressure on media under the BJP. Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw denied government involvement, citing Facebook's policy on abusive content.

title: Police brutality in MP: How party in 'parking lot' ended in tragedy for BTech student
content: A 21-year-old man, Udit Gayaki, died after allegedly being beaten by two on-duty constables while celebrating his graduation. The incident occurred after police reportedly demanded a bribe, leading to an assault.  An autopsy cited pancreatic hemorrhage as the cause of death, and the constables have been suspended.

title: Ground Boeing 787s, demands pilots‚Äô body
content: An Air India Boeing 787 diverted to Dubai due to a technical snag, with its autopilot system failing. This follows another incident last week where a Dreamliner's ram air turbine deployed on approach. The Federation of Indian Pilots has urged the grounding of all B787s amid continuous electrical issues and called for a special audit of Air India's aircraft maintenance.

title: ‚ÄòKiller‚Äô AI warning: Ex-Google CEO says problems in AI possible
content: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt has issued a stark warning about AI security risks. He highlighted the potential for AI to be misused by malicious actors, comparing proliferation dangers to nuclear weapons. Schmidt noted that AI safety mechanisms can be bypassed. Despite these concerns, he expressed optimism about AI's transformative power, suggesting it is underestimated.

title: 'Discussed India-US ties': Jaishankar meets ambassador-designate Sergio Gor
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met US Ambassador-designate Sergio Gor in New Delhi to discuss the growing strategic partnership between India and the United States. Gor's visit aims to familiarize himself with India following his Senate confirmation, with formal credential presentation to follow later.

title: Visa chaos in Serbia: India‚Äôs Chessboxing hopes end; 'We just wanted to play'
content: 11 Indian chessboxing athletes were forced to miss the World Championships in Serbia after their visas weren‚Äôt processed in time, despite applying weeks in advance. The contingent waited outside the Serbian embassy in vain as bureaucratic delays crushed months of preparation. The incident echoes past visa troubles that have cost Indian athletes key opportunities at global events.

title: Gautam Gambhir's straight talk: 'I'll take all criticism for Shubman Gill'
content: Head coach Gautam Gambhir has pledged unwavering support for new ODI captain Shubman Gill, stating he's prepared to absorb all criticism to shield the young leader. Gambhir emphasized Gill's transparency and dedication, noting his "brilliant" start in leadership roles. The coach's commitment aims to foster Gill's growth and ensure team success.

title: Future fear: Bryan Johnson on quitting meat; predicts AI will rule humans
content: Billionaire Bryan Johnson, known for his $2 million anti-aging experiment, has revealed a surprising reason for his plant-based diet: artificial intelligence. Johnson believes that by treating animals ethically now, humans can set a precedent for how future AI systems might treat humanity, aligning with his interest in AI alignment.

title: Israel-Hamas ceasefire deal: US troops arrive in Tel Aviv to oversee truce
content: US troops are deploying to Israel to help manage a Gaza ceasefire, with a 200-member team set to establish a joint control center and coordinate aid. Meanwhile, thousands of displaced Palestinians are returning to devastated areas, facing lingering dangers and uncertainty about lasting peace following the conflict's initial phase.

title: US hits China with 100% tariffs! Will it benefit India? Here‚Äôs what experts say
content: Indian exporters are poised to benefit from increased US tariffs on Chinese goods, potentially shifting demand towards India. Experts believe this escalation, with the US imposing a 100% additional tariff on Chinese imports, will create a level playing field and open significant export opportunities for India in the American market.

title: 'Shocking': Sonia writes to Haryana IPS widow; flags bias against social justice
content: Senior IPS officer Y. Puran Kumar died by suicide, naming 16 IAS and IPS officers in his note for alleged harassment. Sonia Gandhi expressed solidarity with his wife, highlighting the incident as a "grim reminder" of power's biased attitude. The Haryana government has initiated reshuffles in police leadership amid growing pressure.

title: Microsoft engineer quits after 13 years; sends resignation email to employees
content: A senior Microsoft engineer has resigned protesting the company's cloud contracts with the Israeli military. Scott Sutfin-Glowski cited enabling potential atrocities as his reason for leaving. This follows months of internal dissent and employee firings over Gaza-related demonstrations. Microsoft previously stopped some services to an Israeli intelligence unit after a report. However, many contracts remain active, and employee protests continue. Activists demand a complete cut of ties with Israel.

title: Trump‚Äôs 100% tariffs on China: GTRI cautions India, says no deal with US is ever final
content: A GTRI report advises India to negotiate cautiously with the US and prioritize self-reliance over dependence on Washington. The think tank analyzed the impact of US tariffs on China, suggesting India should safeguard its strategic autonomy and strengthen ties with both Western and BRICS nations to mitigate trade shocks.

title: 'Cheapskate tourist': Couple skips hotel stay in Singapore; spends night at Changi Airport instead
content: A couple opted for a budget-friendly sleepover at Singapore's Changi Airport, forgoing expensive hotels during the Formula 1 Grand Prix. Their viral TikTok video documented their experience finding a spot in the airport's 'Sleeper Village,' managing a few hours of rest. While many praised their resourcefulness, some voiced concerns about the impact on the airport's reputation.

title: IND vs WI: ‚ÄòI can never forget that‚Äô: Gambhir opens up on his toughest coaching moment
content: India's head coach Gautam Gambhir revealed that the disappointing home series loss to New Zealand remains a defining low point, influencing his coaching philosophy. He emphasizes the importance of away-from-home success for a world-class team, using the painful memory to instill a never-take-anything-for-granted mindset in his players.

title: 'No name given': After Harjinder Singh, ICE arrests another Indian - What we know so far
content: ICE apprehended an Indian national with a New York commercial driver's license, identified only as 'Anmol,' who allegedly entered the US illegally. Officials claim New York issued the license without proper name verification, posing a public safety risk. However, New York DMV disputes the illegal status, stating the individual has federal work authorization and lawful status.

title: Perverts in public places: Journalist's disturbing encounter exposes Delhi's everyday misogyny
content: A Delhi journalist's daily commute turned terrifying after a man exposed himself and made a lewd gesture. This unsettling incident highlights the pervasive fragility of women's safety in public spaces across Delhi-NCR, where such acts of perversion, often driven by a need for control and dominance, are alarmingly common and deeply impact personal security.

title: Historic feat! After 64 years, Team India smashes batting record vs West Indies
content: Team India achieved a historic feat, recording 50+ partnerships for all first five wickets in a Test innings for the first time in 64 years. This remarkable performance, featuring centuries from Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill, secured a dominant position against West Indies.

title: Shedeur Sanders‚Äô mom Pilar shows support to ex Deion amid health struggles
content: Colorado football coach Deion Sanders faced another health scare undergoing surgery for blood clots. He returned to practice swiftly. His ex-wife Pilar Sanders showed her support by wearing a Colorado sweatshirt. This highlights family unity despite past complexities. Sanders continues coaching while managing his health with loved ones cheering him on.

title: 'Women have equal rights in our country': Rahul slams PM Modi over Taliban presser
content: Opposition leaders have strongly criticized the Taliban's exclusion of women journalists from a press conference in New Delhi, calling it an attack on women's rights and democracy. Leaders like Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi questioned Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led government on the issue, highlighting India's commitment to gender equality and democratic rights.

title: IPS 'suicide' case: Haryana removes Narendra Bijraniya from SP post
content: Following the suicide of senior IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, the Haryana government has replaced Rohtak SP Narendra Bijraniya with Surinder Singh Bhoria. This reshuffle comes amid pressure after Kumar's suicide note named eight senior IPS officers, including DGP Shatrujeet Singh Kapur, alleging harassment. Kumar's wife has demanded their suspension and arrest.

title: Centre to introduce AI in school curriculum from Class 3 in 2026-27
content: From the 2026-27 academic year, India will introduce AI education for students from Class 3 onwards, aligning with NEP 2020. CBSE is developing frameworks and training over one crore teachers. Pilot projects and AI modules are expanding rapidly. The move aims to equip students with essential AI literacy, prepare the workforce for future tech-driven jobs, and position India as a global AI hub.

title: On Diwali, ‚Äògreen crackers‚Äô set to return with a bang
content: The Supreme Court is poised to permit the sale and use of green firecrackers in Delhi and NCR for Diwali, Gurupurav, and Christmas. While reserving orders, the bench questioned the necessity of a complete ban, noting no significant increase in pollution attributed to crackers. The government proposed strict measures, including a ban on series crackers and online sales, to ensure only approved green crackers are available.

title: Nobel Peace winner Maria Machado: A democracy activist forced to live in hiding
content: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado has been awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for her unwavering commitment to democratic rights and her fight for a democratic transition in Venezuela.  Despite facing a ban from public office, Machado's primary victory highlighted widespread support for her vision of liberal economic reforms and a collective struggle for change.

title: Indian IT hit by ‚Äòsilent layoffs‚Äô! 50,000 people may lose jobs
content: India's tech sector is experiencing silent layoffs, with projections of over 50,000 workers impacted by year-end. Companies are reducing surplus staff through performance-linked departures and delayed career advancements, driven by AI adoption and business prudence. This trend signals a shift towards skills management and flatter structures in the industry.

title: ‚ÄòHate messages coming from Pak‚Äô: Wankhede says defamation against Netflix series is personal
content: Former NCB officer Sameer Wankhede has filed a defamation suit against Netflix and Shah Rukh Khan's Red Chillies Entertainment over the series 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'. He claims the show maligns his reputation and insults anti-drug agencies, stating the legal action is personal and for self-respect. Wankhede seeks damages and an injunction against the series' distribution.

title: 'Until you prove it, they don‚Äôt ... ': Samson breaks silence after ODI snub - Watch
content: Rajasthan Royals skipper Sanju Samson identified his maiden international century against South Africa as a career-defining moment. This performance solidified his self-belief, convincing him he belonged at the highest level. Following this century, Samson experienced a career resurgence, excelling in the IPL and earning a T20 World Cup call-up.

title: Chennai ragpicker tied to pole, beaten to death for alleged theft; body dumped in canal
content: A 26-year-old ragpicker met a brutal end near Red Hills, allegedly beaten to death by workers at a plastic chair manufacturing unit. Caught stealing scrap, he was tied to a pole and assaulted with rods before his body was found in a canal. Relatives protested, demanding justice. Police have registered a murder case against the owner and a worker.

title: Delhi: Jugaad culture exposes civic apathy and safety hazards
content: Citizens in Delhi-NCR are resorting to 'jugaad' ‚Äì improvised fixes ‚Äì due to neglected infrastructure. In Ghaziabad, a broken chair warns of a pothole, while in East Delhi, police barricades hide civic failures. Near the Delhi-Meerut Expressway, a dangerous cement slab poses a pedestrian hazard, highlighting ongoing municipal neglect.

title: Amitabh Bachchan keeps promise: Bengal man gets Rs 2L washroom after plea from KBC hot seat
content: Amitabh Bachchan fulfilled his promise to KBC 16 contestant Jayanta Duley by funding the construction of a bathroom for his family.  The 22-year-old sister, Shikha, expressed immense gratitude, stating the gesture preserved women's dignity by ending the embarrassment of bathing in the village pond. This personal intervention highlights Bachchan's commitment to addressing real-life sanitation issues.

title: India-Taliban talks offer a whiff of hope to Delhi‚Äôs own Afghans
content: India's decision to upgrade its technical mission in Kabul to a full embassy has sparked cautious optimism among Delhi's Afghan community. This move offers hope for easier visa processes, renewed trade, and a potential return to stability for families separated by recent events.

title: Talib-can't: Afghan embassy blocks female journalists at Delhi presser; MEA reacts
content: Afghan foreign minister Amir Khan Muttaqi's press conference in Delhi saw no women journalists present, mirroring Taliban's gender curbs. Despite India's suggestion for inclusion, the decision was reportedly made by Taliban officials. Muttaqi deflected questions on women's rights, citing national customs and claiming improved peace and stability since their 2021 takeover.

title: Israel bombs Lebanon: IDF claims to target Hezbollah; 1 killed
content: Israeli forces struck Hezbollah sites in Southern Lebanon. The IDF stated the terror group was rebuilding its infrastructure there. Hezbollah allegedly endangered Lebanese civilians by using them as human shields. This action violates understandings between Israel and Lebanon. Meanwhile, Lebanon arrested 32 individuals suspected of aiding Israel with information on Hezbollah.

title: Are co-ed classrooms in Maharashtra a step towards equality or a cultural challenge?
content: Maharashtra will no longer permit single-gender schools, mandating all institutions to become co-ed. The policy aims to foster gender equality, mutual respect, and social skills, while merging boys‚Äô and girls‚Äô schools under one registration. Critics caution that cultural and regional sensitivities may affect implementation, especially in conservative communities, making careful planning, teacher training, and community engagement essential for success.

title: Trade war 2.0: Why has US threatened to impose additional 100% tariff on China?
content: Trump has imposed 100% tariffs and export bans on Chinese goods, retaliating against Beijing's rare earth mineral export curbs. This move has sent shockwaves through global markets, raising fears of renewed economic confrontation and casting doubt on a planned meeting with Xi Jinping. The escalating tensions threaten global supply chains and investor sentiment.

title: Heavy rains trigger floods and landslides in Mexico, 28 killed ‚Äî Key points
content: Heavy rains in central and southeastern Mexico have caused widespread flooding and landslides, resulting in at least 28 deaths. The deluge damaged thousands of homes, hospitals, and schools, with states like Hidalgo and Puebla reporting significant destruction and power outages. Military personnel have been deployed to assist affected populations.

title: 'It breaks my heart': Meghalaya woman alleges racial abuse twice in an hour in Delhi
content: A Meghalaya flight attendant alleged verbal racial abuse twice in Delhi within an hour, sparking outrage after her video went viral. Union Minister Kiren Rijiju condemned the incidents, urging action against such discrimination and emphasizing India's diversity and equality for all citizens.

title: Why Peter Thiel thinks Greta Thunberg is the 'Antichrist'
content: He speculated that such a figure would likely be youthful, charismatic and constantly warning about global catastrophe. ‚ÄúThe Antichrist,‚Äù he said, ‚Äúis someone talking about Armageddon non-stop.‚Äù As an example, he cited climate activist Greta Thunberg, 22, who has become a leading voice for radical climate action.

title: Shubman Gill shatters Rohit Sharma's record, becomes India's top ...
content: Shubman Gill has surpassed Virat Kohli to become the highest Indian run-scorer in the ICC World Test Championship. Gill achieved this milestone with his second consecutive half-century in the ongoing series against the West Indies, accumulating 2,757 runs in 39 matches. This achievement places him ahead of other prominent Indian batters in the WTC standings.

title: ‚ÄòTireless champion‚Äô: PM Modi pays homeage to JP; recalls 1975 Emergency atrocities
content: Prime Minister Modi honored Jayaprakash Narayan on his birth anniversary, recognizing him as a "tireless champion for democracy and social justice." Modi highlighted JP's "Sampoorna Kranti" movement and his role in challenging the 1975 Emergency, sharing poignant excerpts from JP's "Prison Diary" to underscore his unwavering commitment to democratic values and citizen empowerment.

title: Supreme Court seeks government, EC response on allowing undertrials to vote
content: A Public Interest Litigation in the Supreme Court questions why undertrial prisoners, presumed innocent, are denied voting rights under Section 62(5) of the Representation of People Act. The petition highlights that an estimated five lakh undertrials are disenfranchised, a situation contrasting with practices in other nations. The court has sought responses from the Centre and the Election Commission, though a similar plea was dismissed previously.

title: Man kills nephew over sewing unit dispute; chops body into 5 pieces, dumps in rivulet
content: A dispute over a jointly owned sewing unit led to a brutal murder in Surat. A 25-year-old man was allegedly hacked into five pieces by his maternal uncle after refusing to end their partnership and part with business assets. The nephew had been missing since October 6th, and his body was found dumped in a rivulet.

title: Cough syrup row: Another sample from same batch of Coldrif fails testing
content: Another batch of Coldrif cough syrup tested positive for diethylene glycol, prompting MPFDA to ban three syrups and initiate a market recall. Coldrif, linked to 23 child deaths in Chhindwara, was primarily distributed locally, while Respifresh and Relife reached numerous districts across Madhya Pradesh.

title: Haryana Cop Named In Suicide Note Of IPS Officer Y Puran Kumar Transferred
content: The Haryana government on Saturday transferred Rohtak Superintendent of Police Narendra Bijarniya, days after IPS officer Y Puran Kumar allegedly shot himself dead at his Chandigarh residence, officials said.

title: Trinamool To Hold 100 'Bijoya Sammelani' Meetings, Electoral Rolls In Focus
content: The Trinamool Congress is set to hold 100 'Bijoya Sammelani' meetings on Sunday - with the focus on Special Intensive Revision (SIR) and public outreach before the 2026 elections.

title: Fall Of Bira 91: How A Name Change Led To Beer Brand's Dramatic Collapse
content: A minor legal name change from B9 Beverages Private Limited to B9 Beverages Limited has triggered regulatory hurdles, halted sales and intensified employee unrest at Bira 91.

title: Delhi Cops Reunite Intellectually-Challenged Woman With Family After 37 Days
content: Delhi Police has reunited a 21-year-old intellectually-challenged woman from Madhya Pradesh, who was found abandoned in a pregnant state in Shahdara last month, with her family after a 37-day search, officials said on Saturday.

title: S Jaishankar Meets US Ambassador-Designate Sergio Gor Amid Trade Tensions
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Saturday held talks with US ambassador-designate Sergio Gor amid continuing strains in the relations over Washington's imposition of 50 per cent tariffs on Indian exports.

title: Election Body Seeks Video Of Mamata Banerjee Warning State Poll Chief: Sources
content: The Election Commission of India has sought the video of Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee making threatening remarks against West Bengal's Chief Electoral Officer (CEO), said sources, months before the eastern state votes to elect a new government.

title: North Korea Displays 'Most Powerful' Missile At Parade With Russia, China In Attendance
content: North Korea showed off its "most powerful" intercontinental ballistic missile at a military parade attended by top officials from Russia and China.

title: Spurned By INDIA Bloc, AIMIM To Contest 100 Seats In Bihar Polls: A Owaisi
content: The AIMIM, which has been spurned by the INDIA bloc in Bihar, on Saturday said it was planning to contest around 100 seats in the upcoming state assembly polls, five times the number it had fought in the last elections.

title: IndiGo Aircraft's Windshield Cracks Before Landing In Chennai, Fliers Safe
content: A crack in the windshield of an aircraft belonging to the largest domestic airliner, IndiGo, carrying 76 passengers from Madurai was detected by the pilot ahead of its landing at the airport in Chennai on Saturday, authorities said.

title: Karnataka Man Steals Rs 47 Lakh In Gold, Cash From Relative's Home To Fund His Wedding
content: A 22-year-old man from Karnataka has been arrested for allegedly stealing gold and cash from his relative's house to fund his wedding with his girlfriend.

title: Opinion: Opinion | This Is Really Why Machado 'Dedicated' Her Nobel To Trump
content: It is perhaps fitting, in this age of irony and inversion, that the Nobel Peace Prize of 2025 has not gone to Trump, the self-proclaimed dealmaker of destiny.

title: Why Nobel Peace Prize Winner Maria Corina Machado Is Facing Criticism
content: A controversy has surfaced after Venezuelan democracy activist Maria Corina Machado was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize 2025.

title: Apple Sued Over Use Of Copyrighted Books To Train Apple Intelligence
content: Apple was hit with a lawsuit in California federal court by a pair of neuroscientists who say that the tech company misused thousands of copyrighted books to train its Apple Intelligence artificial intelligence model.

title: CRPF Constable Killed In IED Blast During Anti-Maoist Operation In Jharkhand
content: A CRPF jawan died after he was injured in an IED blast during an anti-Maoist operation in Jharkhand, officials said on Saturday.

title: 'True Soldier Of BJP': Pawan Singh Rules Out Contesting Bihar Assembly Polls
content: Bhojpuri superstar Pawan Singh on Saturday announced that he would not contest the upcoming assembly polls in Bihar, and said he would continue to remain as a "soldier" of the BJP.

title: White House Begins Mass Layoffs Amid Government Shutdown
content: The White House said Friday it had begun mass layoffs of federal workers as President Donald Trump sought to amp up pressure on opposition Democrats to end a government shutdown that has crippled public services.

title: Canadian Foreign Minister To Visit India, Trade, Energy On Agenda
content: Canadian Foreign Minister Anita Anand will embark on a diplomatic tour of India, Singapore, and China from October 12 to 17 (Canadian time) to advance cooperation and strengthen bilateral relations under Canada's Indo-Pacific Strategy

title: "We Had No Role": IT Minister On Akhilesh Yadav's Facebook Account Suspension
content: Akhilesh Yadav regularly used his Facebook page to share his views, highlight the government's "shortcomings", and connect with supporters.

title: Akasa Air Flight From Pune Suffers Bird Hit, Lands Safely In Delhi
content: An Akasa Air aircraft flying from Pune to Delhi suffered a bird hit on Friday and landed safely in the national capital.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Northeasterner: Indian, Until Someone Needs A Punchline - By Vir Sanghvi
content: The racism we casually throw at those from the North East is not so different - or any less offensive - from the racism that Indians face in the West. Yet, we remain blind to it.

title: How the Aces defeated the Mercury in Game 4
content: the Las Vegas Aces beat the Phoenix Mercury 97-86 in the 2025 WNBA finals . the Aces are the 7th franchise to win at least three titles in four years . it's their third championship in a four-game sweep .

title: Roy Williams' Superman dive and more iconic Red River Rivalry moments
content: the annual showdown between the Texas Longhorns and Oklahoma Sooners brings a memorable atmosphere . this year, intrigue about the game is especially high, as Texas began the season as the no. 1 team in the country but is still in search of its first win against a power conference opponent . the availability of Sooners quarterback John Mateer is uncertain after a hand injury sustained earlier in the season .

title: Premier League depth charts for most popular teams
content: the premier league season is seven games in and the transfer window is closed until Jan. 1 . there will be no more incomings or outgoings unless a free agent can be snapped up . here are depth charts of the best options for the first XI .

title: Pondicherry University students lathicharged, arrested for protesting #MeToo by faculty
content: the protesters were demanding the immediate suspension of faculty members on Karaikal and Puducherry campuses accused of sexually harassing research scholars and students . the students were also demanding the reconstitution of an internal complaints committee (ICC) in accordance with UGC‚Äôs sexual harassment of women employees and students in higher educational institutions regulations .
